nl.uu.cs.ape.sat.constraints

Class ConstraintTemplate

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.uu.cs.ape.sat.constraints.ConstraintTemplate
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Constraint_depend_module, Constraint_gen_type, Constraint_if_gen_then_not_type, Constraint_if_gen_then_type, Constraint_if_then_module, Constraint_if_then_not_module, Constraint_if_use_then_not_type, Constraint_if_use_then_type, Constraint_last_module, Constraint_next_module, Constraint_not_gen_type, Constraint_not_use_module, Constraint_not_use_type, Constraint_nth_module, Constraint_prev_module, Constraint_use_module, Constraint_use_type

    public abstract class ConstraintTemplate
extends java.lang.Object
    The ConstraintTemplate class is an abstract class used to represent a general constraint template.
    Author:
    Vedran Kasalica

      • getConstraint

        public abstract java.lang.String getConstraint(java.lang.String[] parameters,
                                               AllModules allModules,
                                               AllTypes allTypes,
                                               ModuleAutomaton moduleAutomaton,
                                               TypeAutomaton typeAutomaton,
                                               AtomMapping mappings)
        Method will return a CNF representation of the constraint in DIMACS format. It will use predefined mapping function and all the atoms will be mapped to numbers accordingly.
        Parameters:
        parameters - - array of input parameters
        allModules - - list of all the modules
        moduleAutomaton - - module automaton
        typeAutomaton - - type automaton
        mappings - - set of the mappings for the literals
        Returns:
        String CNF representation of the constraint. NULL in case of incorrect number of constraint parameters.

      • printConstraintCode

        public java.lang.String printConstraintCode()
        Print the template for encoding the constraint, containing the template ID, description and required number of parameters.
        Returns:
        String representing the description.

      • throwParametersError

        public void throwParametersError(int givenParameters)
        Throwing an error in case of having a wrong number of parameters in the constraints file.
        Parameters:
        givenParameters - Provided number of parameters
